class.name: OpenXRAndroidTrackablePlaneTracker
class.description: A tracker for a plane (from [code]XR_ANDROID_trackables[/code]). See also [OpenXRAndroidTrackablesExtension].

method.name: get_extents
method.description: Returns the width and height, or [member Vector2.x] and [member Vector2.y] respectively. The width and height are centered on the pose from [method OpenXRAndroidTrackableTracker.get_center_pose]. For example, a width of [code]2[/code] means the extents extend [code]1[/code] to the left and right of the center pose.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Returns an indexed [ArrayMesh], which can be assigned to [member MeshInstance3D.mesh]. This mesh is constructed from the same vertices returned by [method get_vertices].

method.name: get_plane_label
method.description: Return the [enum PlaneLabel] for this tracker.

method.name: get_plane_type
method.description: Return the [enum PlaneType] for this tracker.

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Returns a [ConcavePolygonShape3D] representing the plane, which can be assigned to [member CollisionShape3D.shape]. [param thickness] is how thick to make the shape, in meters. Positive values extend the thickness behind the plane, while negative values extend the thickness in front of the plane. A thickness of [code]0.0[/code] will return [code]null[/code].

method.name: get_subsumed_by_plane
method.description: Return the [OpenXRAndroidTrackablePlaneTracker] that subsumes this plane. Can be [code]null[/code].

method.name: get_vertices
method.description: Return a [PackedVector3Array] of vertices that outline the plane, counterclockwise. These vertices are in local space (i.e centered about the origin) and do not form a valid mesh. Use [method get_mesh] if all you need is a mesh.
